newsitem.title: USA: Great American buys hotels, stock falls.
newsitem.headline: Great American buys hotels, stock falls.

text.p: Great American Hotels & Resorts Inc's Gold Coast Security Trust Properties said Thursday it bought 80 percent of the outstanding shares of JACJON Inc, which owns a Days Inn, Super 8, and Poor Man's Castle Restaurant, all in Vero Beach, Florida.
The remaining 20 percent stake was bought by another investor, whose identity was not disclosed. The total purchase price was $4.4 million in cash and debt, the company said.
Shares of Great American fell 40 percent, losing 1 to 1-1/2 in early trading on Thursday.
In 1996, the three operations posted revenues of $2,800,000 and net operating income of $1,020,000.
Based on 1996 results, the acquisitions are expected to quadruple the company's revenues from about $800,000 to about $3.6 million annually, the company said.
